answers.author: Gail Ann Clark
answers.text:
The Project for Public Spaces is a good resource for information on community parks and facilities.   Project for Public Spaces | Placemaking for Communities   
www.pps.org/   
Nonprofit technical assistance, research, and educational organization whose mission is to create and sustain public places that build communities   
The PPS and GSA together published this 2007 book entitled "Achieving Great Federal Public Spaces: A Property Manager’s Guide" which includes an evaluation section that may be to be quite useful.    The following information comes from their website ...   
"Achieving Great Federal Public Spaces is an invaluable book for property managers, developers, and anyone else who wants to evaluate and improve their lobbies, atriums, plazas, courtyards, and other public spaces.   
Written and designed by PPS and the General Services Administration–the real estate arm of the federal government–the book is both a hands-on resource with on-site exercises and a handy reference tool full of ideas and inspiration. It comprises four major sections, available for download as free PDFs:   
•   Introduction – (click here to download)   
Why great places matter and what makes a good public space. >  
•   Evaluation – (click here to download)   
How to determine which aspects of a building’s public space need improvement, and which are performing well.   
•   Solutions – (click here to download)   
What improvements work in the short-, medium-, and long-term.   
•   Implementation – (click here to download)   
How to successfully put ideas into practice.   
The centerpiece of the book is the “Place Audit,” a detailed on-site evaluation exercise that property managers can complete on their own or with a group of stakeholders. The Audit reveals the strengths and weaknesses of a property’s public spaces. Equipped with this knowledge, property managers can proceed with confidence to implement the book’s recommendations for improvement."

author: Octavio Chavez
text: ICMA and ICMA Latinoamerica are working in Mexico with a USAID sponsor program that involves Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design (CPTED) and Smart Growth concepts. We need to somehow classify the conditions of several public infrastructures, such a community parks, centers and sport facilities. We would like to see if there are forms to make a classification or ranking depending on their conditions and usage.
title: Assessing the conditions of public infrastructure
